service_endpoints.title: Service Endpoints
service_endpoints.description: Service endpoints can be added to DID Documents.

fees.title: Explicit Fees
fees.description: Creation, modification or deletion of identifiers require a transaction fee, e.g. blockchain-based DID methods often require transaction fees.

self-certifying.title: Self-Certifying
self-certifying.description: DID and the initial DID Document are cryptographically bound to one another, e.g. `did:key`.

rotatable_keys.title: Rotatable Keys
rotatable_keys.description: The DID method supports rotation of keys to control the DID.

pre-rotatable_keys.title: Pre-Rotatable Keys
pre-rotatable_keys.description: Cryptographic keys can be pre-rotated to combat key loss and attacks by quantum computers. - Comment by Juan: one thing working with the KERI WG at DIF taught me was that there are like 10 different capabilities/flows that people refer to when they mean rotation. rotation in case of key exfiltration? manual rotation by controller? regular/automated rotation NOT requiring manual controller intervention?

modifiable_multi-sig.title: Multi-Signature Modifiable
modifiable_multi-sig.description: The method supports multiple DID controllers, with multiple key signatures required to update or deactivate the DID. - Comment by Juan: threshold versus multisig goes all the way back to christopher allan's BTC pre-DID research and some of the oldest did-wg megathreads, worth picking carefully a definition. joe andreiu probably has something detailed written up about this somewhere..

enumerable.title: Enumerable
enumerable.description: All DIDs of this method can be enumerated, i.e. a public registry like a DLT exists that references all existing DIDs.

locally_resolvable.title: Locally Resolvable
locally_resolvable.description: DID documents can be resolved in an ephameral local context, e.g. `did:peer`.

globally_resolvable.title: Globally Resolvable
globally_resolvable.description: DID documents can be resolved globally.

documents.title: Documents Hosting
documents.description: Additional documents can be hosted with the DID Document and dereferenced via DID paths.

history.title: DID Document History
history.description: Previous versions of DID documents are available and can be dereferenced.

history_immutable.title: Immutable DID Document History
history_immutable.description: Changes to DID Documents are persisted in an immutable data structure, e.g. a DLT.

not_hosted.title: Not Hosted
not_hosted.description: No hosting of DID Document required, e.g. ephameral `did:key` documents.

centrally_hosted.title: Centrally Hosted
centrally_hosted.description: Hosted on a centralized service, e.g. a web server.

decentrally_hosted.title: Decentrally Hosted
decentrally_hosted.description: Hosted on a decentralized service, e.g. a DLT.
